description: Aspose.Slides is a PowerPoint management library for working with Microsoft PowerPoint files without using Microsoft PowerPoint. It allows developers to work with PPT, PPS, POT, PPTX, PPSX, POTX and ODP files on ASP.NET web applications, web services and Windows applications.
releaseNotes:
This release introduces the features, enhancements and bug fixes as detailed below:
	

	New Feature:

SLIDESNET-34733	Support for altering pictures added into the image collection of a presentation

	Enhancement:

SLIDESNET-34686	Drop support for .NET 1.1.

	Bugs:

SLIDESNET-33673	The bullet rendered in wrong color for generated PDF
SLIDESNET-34453	Index out of range exception on adding HTML text
SLIDESNET-34505	Nan is returned when accessing the portion font height
SLIDESNET-34532	InvalidCastException on using CreateParagraphFormatData()
SLIDESNET-34592	Font family failed to get applied on portion text
SLIDESNET-34693	NullReference Exception on saving presentation
SLIDESNET-34694	IndexOutOfRange Exception on saving presentation
SLIDESNET-34719	Charts with a multi-level category axis are improperly rendered
SLIDESNET-34728	Double bullets are rendered in generated PDF
SLIDESNET-34729	Chart line is missing in generated Pdf

	Sub-tasks:

SLIDESNET-34043	Chart is missing in generated thumbnail
SLIDESNET-34044	Chart category and value axis are improperly rendered
SLIDESNET-34045	Major horizontal and vertical lines are missing in generated thumbnail
SLIDESNET-34720	Support for rendering of multi-level category axis.
SLIDESNET-34721	Support for rendering shapes in Chart Drawing part
SLIDESNET-34722	Font of category axis looks bigger than in original
summary: Aspose.Slides is a PowerPoint management library for working with Microsoft PowerPoint files without using Microsoft PowerPoint. It allows developers to work with PPT, PPS, POT, PPTX, PPSX, POTX and ODP files on ASP.NET web applications, web services and Windows applications. It allows you to open files and manipulate the elements of the presentation from adding slides and managing variety of shapes and working with text to more complex elements like presentation protection, slide animations, charts and SmartArt rendering.The presentations can be exported to PDF, TIFF, XPS, SVG, PNG, JPEG, BMP or EMF formats.
title: Aspose.Slides for .NET
